name: Offspring Fling!
description: Offspring Fling is a game about a poor forest creature that has misplaced all of her children.
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP Processor:Intel Core 2 Duo or Equivalent Memory:1 GB RAM Graphics:Any with Hardware 3d Acceleration DirectX®:7.0 Hard Drive:95 MB HD space Sound:On Board
recommended_requirements: OS:Windows 7 Processor:Intel Core 2 Duo or Above Memory:2 GB RAM Graphics:nVidia 7000 Series or Above DirectX®:9.0c Hard Drive:95 MB HD space Sound:On Board

reviews.review_text: This game literally caused a blister in my thumb, but after getting 100% completition, I finally feel ready to review this game properly.  As you may have already read from other reviews here, Offspring Fling hides much more than it seems at a first glance. Playing this game casually results into a peaceful experience with a puzzle platformer with short levels and easy-to-get mechanics, including the basic as jumping, grabbing, throwing...   But playing this game in a serious way uncovers the true potential it has to offer. Offspring Fling is actually a game crafted for people who loves to speedrun, and challenge you not only to beat the levels, but also to do that in a certain time mark. Most of them are extremely tight and accurate, and involves doing very hidden skills that could even look like game flaws for some people, while they're actually crucial techiques in order to beat most levels in time. Even the most basic techniques require a huge amount of timing if you want to do all the tricks this game has; it's even comparable to executing long combos in fighting games, no joking.  If anyone of you check my game stats, you'll see that there's a lapse of TWO YEARS between some achievements. This proves how much time I've been denying this game 'cause it basically felt too strong to me back then. But after 2 years playing A LOT of platformers, I eventually felt ready for Offspring Fling, and even like that it's been a true challenge for me.  All in all, this game can be played by anybody no matter what's your purpose in games (either casual or hardcore gaming), and will successfully give you what you want. Nevertheless after taking the challenge I truly recommend playing this game for the time trial stuff since you'll be surprised about how deep and complex this title is.    Final Mark : My Blistered Thumb UP.

100/100 Levels beaten #About 3 hours to completion  A fun platformer revolving around picking up smaller characters and taking them to the exit. Levels are (mostly) single screen and quick.  Pros - (So Far) Every level is challanging enough without seeming impossible. It does get a bit dicey on a handful of level though. - Level Editor - Charming art style. - Fun!  Cons: - Crashed several times on loadup. Might be controller i had attached? - There are a few levels where you have to catch one of the kids in midair after a jump. This is made super akward in that you pick them up (normally) by pressing down and they didnt change this for these types of situations. So pretty jump, then a direction, and then down in mid-air, and then a direction or command while you are holding them. All in a few seconds. I managed, but it can get frustrating.
i threw a baby 10/10

* I guess i'll add my opinion about level 101-120 since i just beat it today.    My playtime:  32.9h (based on steam, 100% achievement) 19h (based on steam, 100 blue/99 golden/99 rainbow flower)  Comparing it to Angry Birds: Blue flower = 1 star Golden flower = 2 stars Rainbow flower = 3 stars   Grindy Achievement:  No.  Optional Achievement:  Yes (5 achievements).  Difficult Achievement:  Yes (8 achievements. Seriously, this game is hard).  Developer Response:  No (last response is in 14 Nov 2015, but you'll get a response in around 24h if you email the dev).   Intro

Solve puzzles by flinging your offspring around under the guise you're trying to save them. A charming game with scaling puzzles and difficulty as you advance. Play in short bursts otherwise the game can quickly outstay it's welcome.

Well, this game is by far one of the best games I've ever bought.   First of all, even though it's cute, it's pretty difficult, what makes the game last for a long time. But, because of this, you'll need to be patient. There's a lot of levels to play, with 3 different grades defined by the time you spent to beat the level (blue = normal time; gold = good time; rainbow = excelent time).  It may look simple, but it's not. There are some techniques that are necessary to learn in order to beat some levels.  Although it's very hard, it's still very fun! And it's not that expensive, what makes it even better.  Do you like cuteness? Do you have the money? BUY IT!   100/10

While the gameplay mechanics are fun and interesting, this fresh approach to the puzzle/platform genre never actually impresses. The music is good, but there aren't enough tracks to remain enjoyable. The 16-bit art style is cute, but the main character's design is too derived from Nintendo's Kirby.  Offspring Fling is okay.
Cute puzzle game. Does get a little tricky later on though.

Offspring Fling is a pazzel paltformer where you pllay as a forest creature and have to find yuor kids and get them to the exit. The levels start off ease but incress in difficulty and you also will have to advoid hostil creatures and hazzards. At the end of each leavel you you be given the time you did it in and a flower. If you finnished over the par time you get a blue star or if you get par or under you get a golden flower. If you choose to replay the leavel you get to see a gost image of yourseld from the last play through you did to help better and improve yourself. If you got a gold star you see a gost image of the dev playing the leavel. The deve has a time lower then the par time but i dont know if something special happens if you pet the devs time because i havent been able to do it it.  I have only played it at this stage on the keyboard and the controlls fell a bit slugish so you are proble better off using a controller but i cant confrem that.  The menu is basic and apart from the level selection the it doesnt explain that well what the other selections are so it is trail and error. The option menu is basic and nnot much to speak of although it doent need much but would be nice if there was diffrent resuloution options.  Over all it is fub and enjoubale and at times addictive. If you enjou pazzle platfomers and or like speed running games and enjoy challange your self to constle improve at leaves to see how fas you can do it then i recoment it   Even if you not into the speed running part it is still a fun game to play or have a look you do get a sence of aclopshment and pride when you figure out a level. This is sutible for all ages and icausle players or speed runners
I AM THE GREATEST MOTHER THAT HAS EVER EXISTED THE MUSIC IN THIS GAME DOES NOT BELONG IN A PUZZLE PLATFORMER IT BELONGS IN A FANTASY RPG OF SOME KIND

Obligatory cute and fuzzy things: Check Puzzle platformer: Check Adorable music: Check  Easy to pick up feel-good platformer with puzzle elements and cuteness abound.  Your rewards are flowers for god-sakes!!  10/10
An original platformer flinging babies makes this all the more fun. Challenging and fun levels kept me coming back.
I would say this is some good classic SNUS type game fun but i dont know what that means

It's an alright puzzle platformer. Throwing babies as a concept is amazing, but I didn't find it particularly enjoyable. I remember wishing that the game would end already, and it only took me 2 hours. It's fine if you like puzzle platformers, but I'd only get it really cheap or in a bundle.

Crashed over and over on my old computer. Figured I'd just try it again when I got a new computer, but it crashes even more now! I can't even play a level and it took three crashes just to get through the intro sequence.
is a flash game
I don't remember getting this

There are some games that come to you, you install them, open them, play them for a while, and you don't know why but nothing about it is cool or enjoyable.  That was my case with this game... I can't seem to like ANYTHING about it. After 0.5 hours of playing it and 2 hours of letting it open to take the cards, is now in my 'Hidden' steam library list.

You can get about 30 minutes' worth of game out of this, but that's all it's good for. Sluggish controls, blocky graphics and a lack of updates make this game a nightmare for achievement hunters or anybody who wants more out of the game than a quick puzzle-platformer fix.  Let me save you some money: Super Meat Boy is superior in every way. Buy that game instead.

This is a babby throwing simulator where you go and throw babbies around and get them into the goal.  The game itself is pretty cool, althpugh frustrating at some points as it sometimes relies on twitch reactions which may or may not be a good thing for some people.  It also looks and sounds rather pretty with the artstyle somehow reminding me of a mashup of Yoshi's Island and Super Meat Boy.  If you like throwing little babbies around, get this. If you don't like throwing babbies around, then don't get this.
THROW YOUR ♥♥♥♥ING BABIES JUST DO IT YOU ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥
The most fun throwing children you will ever have.

I liked the concept behind this game. And I enjoyed the first 40 or so levels of it. And then I had to call in a specialist, because what I wanted was a puzzler that used platforming as an aesthetic rather than a key mechanic. I have no ability nor patience for twitchy exactly timed actions, and that's the entire latter half the of the game. Likewise, while the sound design is cute, it provides no 'information'. This game has absolutely no aural cues. The times for gold and white flowers are equivalent to 'perfect' and 'you have done something fishy'.   That said, while I can't give this game a blessing for all players (twitch mechanics and exact jumping put it right out of the running for accessibility), if you enjoy platformers more than puzzlers, you will like this game.

At first I was like : meh. Then i was like : Awwww, too cute.  It seems quite simple. And it kinda is if you just do the campaign. But if you try to beat the golden times and the developper's time, you'll have some serious challenge for some hours. And you'll be amazed by all the motherly love in this game.
This is a Flawless Puzzle game. Highly Reccomended. Its whimsical and lighthearted, cute and has personality and good game friction on top of a solid puzzle mechanic it excersizes over its levels.
Puzzle game, good stuff, looks like it could have been on the SuperNES. Expect the usual puzzle game wall to come up where you get stuck and may need help.

An extremely smart addictive puzzle game that leaves you asking for more levels after you are done with it.Not particularly hard to grasp but as the game progresses trying to get the best time is what really makes the game challenging to beat.  Highly recommended for people that enjoy solving challenges for a good time pass.

its actually really fun. and its like 2 bucks. So get over yourselves and buy it cause theres hundreds of levels and I can throw babies into lava pits for fun in this game.  Also, reptar makes an appearance, if you dont know who reptar is. Go ♥♥♥♥ yourself, and watch Rugrats. He's awesome, and you throw babies at reptar. So this game is fun.
7/10 A fun, short, enjoyable romp. I enjoyed the play through, didn't go for any all star times. Could offer solid challenges for speed runners.
Kind of like a NES puzzle-platformer.
Throwing your babies around like that can't possibly have any repercussions...right?
The game kind of reminds me of my home life and how my mom beats me.
Throw babies to win tha game.
Probabily the cutiest game ever! You get to play as a great parent who throws children and sometimes kills them. 10/10
Delightfully simple puzzle platformer. It doesn't take long to beat, but it'll take you insanely long to perfect. I do feel it could have possibly offered a bit more, though.
Fantastic sound track, beautiful graphics... overall this game is sheer joy to play! No exageration.

Hard as heck, was an alright game though, I beat the first 100 in 3 hours, that being said I am not to great at platformers. Worth a buy, there really isn't a story, other than saving your kids. It's a cute game for sure. Never repetive surprisingly due to the fact that the game constantly throws new challanges and objects at you.
Very cool little game!
Very good and cute oldschool feel of that lost time/childhood we spent throwing chicks around our families' backyards. Won't disappoint.
